data.name: λ Lua
content: Lua is the {{lightweight}} {{scripting language}} of choice for many {{game engines}} and {{embedded systems}}.
I have been using Lua for over {{6 years}} and I am pretty familiar with it. I have used it to build {{games}}, {{automation scripts}}, and even {{animation scripts}}
I have used Lua to create {{unfair game advantage exploits}}, {{server scripts within a game}}.
I have also used Lua to develop {{projects}} for {{hobbyists}}, {{startups}}, {{game creators}}.

data.name:  Python
content: Python is the {{versatile}} {{programming language}} of choice for many {{web developers}} and {{data scientists}}.
I have been using Python for about {{2 years}} and I am familiar with it. I have used it to build {{various tools}}, {{automation scripts}}, {{generating scripts}}, and even {{bots}}
I have also used Python to develop {{projects}} for me and some of my friends.

data.name:  Linux
content:
Linux is an {{operating system}} based on {{Unix}}.
It dominates the {{server}} space but is also the basis for the {{Android}} phone operating system.

I have been using Linux for {{2-3 years}} and I am quite familiar with it.
Although I've tried various flavors ({{distributions}}), I usually go back to {{Arch based}} distributions.

Linux is a {{go-to}} tool for me and, by far, the best development environment I've used.
It is {{free}}, {{open-source}}, {{fast}}, {{stable}}, {{secure}}, {{customizable}} and {{extremely powerful}}.
I have Linux installed as my main OS on my Laptop, And if you're curious the Distro i'm currently running is OMARCHY. It's pretty new, And super easy to set up if you're lazy like me.

data.name:  Neovim
content:
Neovim is a {{text editor}} based on Vim, it is {{keyboard-centric}}, meaning that it was designed around keyboard navigation and supports multiple modes, making it possible to move around the text with the {{keyboard keys}} ({{Normal}} mode) before selecting ({{Visual}} mode) or writing ({{Insert}} mode).
Neovim brings a whole deal of {{customizability}} through {{Lua}} scripting as well as a lot of community-made extensions.

I have started using it in the middle of {{2023}} and have still a lot to {{learn}} about it, like {{buffers}} and power-user {{navigation}} but I use it for {{everything}} and feel at home when using it.
I even wrote an extension to allow better use of the debugger with {{npm}}.
